author: Paul Rankin
method: In a large bowl mix together the cornflour, salt and coriander. Add the king prawns and toss until coated. Heat the vegetable oil in a deep, heavy-bottomed saucepan. It is ready when a breadcrumb which is dropped in sizzles gently in it. (CAUTION: hot oil can be dangerous. Do not leave unattended.) Deep fry the prawns for 30 seconds, then drain on kitchen towels.  Serve the prawns in a warm bowl.
ingredients: 1 tbsp cornflour,  1 tbsp Maldon sea salt,  1 tbsp chopped coriander,  5 king prawns, peeled, tails left on,  500ml/17fl oz vegetable oil, for frying
